website_summaries.verdict: The HP LaserJet 1020 is a good deal for home users who have light print needs, but just a little bit more money can get you more features and better print quality.
pros: manual feed tray for one-off prints

customer_reviews.title: HP Laserjet 1020 printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer to buy, old but does the job. HP's are quality printers. There may be replacements for this one, but I wouldn't care, this works for my Windows 8.1 laptop very well. It is portable, fits on my desk and prints text or photos in B&W well. It does not shake my desk, like an even older cartridge printer I also have. Smooth, clear printing is the result. Check the manual with descriptions for the size footprint and DPI, "dots per inch" for printing. Overall, this is a good, competent printer to buy, not too expensive, and one that will work well with an older computer.
customer_reviews.author: David Schaedler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer for Windows 7/10!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this printer so much at work, I bought my own for home. The printer and drivers have been flawless for numerous Windows 7 and Windows 10 machines. The printer output is crisp and clear. Printing starts as soon as you hit the [print] button, and is fairly fast, especially for the price. Paper jams are very rare, and the innards easily accessible on the rare occasion that it happens. Finally, the printer is very compact, allowing you to utilize it even in tight quarters. Note that a large number of the negative reviews are due to issues with this printer and Vista. If you are running a Windows OS after Vista, you should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: J. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Best Desk Printer for last 10 years.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Printer probably in 2006? 2007? I bought 2 of them online, They are Hecka cheap online. I gotta say, for an HP printer. this thing never dies. HP failed to make money of this guy. I've been printing for over a decade and still going. Seriously the best Personal Black and white USB printer i've seen. Never settle for an Inkjet printer when you can have Laser-jet. We've replaced toner probably 4 times now.
customer_reviews.author: GuyJeb

customer_reviews.title: Still Tickin'
customer_reviews.text: I'm going on 10 years. Never had a problem; this has been totally reliable. I do go for HP branded ink cartridges, which may help account for its reliability. It has been connected to every Window OS between 3.1 and 10 and I/ve never had driver or operation problems. It's a USB connection, but that's fine since I've always had problems with WiFi printer connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Pop Bop

customer_reviews.title: best printer ever
customer_reviews.text: best printer ever. I had to return it because the printer was broken during delivery. But if you ever need to buy a printer this is the printer I would suggest to buy because no software download needed. it is plug and play. as soon as you plug in with the cable, computer automatically recognize the printer and ready to print.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This printer is the last of the great HP printers- what I like about it is that ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer is the last of the great HP printers- what I like about it is that I can use whatever compatible toner available without the printer rejecting it. The printer was in great shape when it arrived. Thanks...
customer_reviews.author: Alberto Borges

customer_reviews.title: Solved my problem
customer_reviews.text: Plugged in and worked. Missing tray was replaced with one from my original printer with no problem. Solved my problem.
customer_reviews.author: George H. Steele

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer (April 2010 update)
customer_reviews.text: Home office application: Used it nearly 3 years now with no problems. Works well: prints addresses on envelopes, recipe cards...whatever and does it fast. Refilled the toner cartridge a couple of years ago and it is still going. Hp does not have much toner in them when they leave the factory. To refill the toner cardtridge, I had to put 2 holes in the cartridge... 1 for adding new toner in the supply compartment and 1 to remove the old excess toner from the waste compartment.
customer_reviews.author: Diyguy

customer_reviews.title: a little powerhouse
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a huge HP LaserJet 4 Plus from 1994. The 1020 is a fourth the size, but faster and with better print. My only complaint is the handling of envelopes: it insists on a manual click to finish, and you can only do one envelope at a time, unlike the old LaserJet Plus. Overall, a fine printer for the money, but I doubt I will get 12 years of constant service with it as I did with the Plus - they don't make 'em like that anymore, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Thop

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE if you use WordPerfect
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer for our law office. While it is a nice printer, it DOES NOT function with WordPerfect, which is the word processor we use. Nor was this problem mentioned in any review I came across. [Edited to add that I did find a work around: you have to load the PrintServer120.exe file at start up. Something that HP certainly never told me. At any rate, all's well that ends well and this one did.]
customer_reviews.author: Aspasia

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised as far as model and condition....
customer_reviews.text: It arrived in a timely fashion but it wasn't what was advertised. It was a HP LaserJet 1018; not a 1020. Also, the drum is coated with toner that is showing up in varying degrees when printing. Either slightly or pretty recognizably.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this printer. I'm a writer and a writer who doesn't particularly like reading off a computer screen. I can't see the flow, and make easy notes, or get an overall vibe of the thing while reading off a screen. Plus, I'm also starting a PhD program in the next month and so printing is a necessity. I don't need the absolute fastest, and I don't need the absolute best quality. What I need is a solid, laser printer that fits into my decidedly narrow budget. This fit perfectly and it works perfectly as well. I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O

customer_reviews.title: HP LaserJet 1020 printer
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for about a year. It is a great printer and I think it is a bargain considering the quality of the printing and the reliability of the machine. There are no negatives. Even if you have an inkjet printer it pays to get one of these just to do work that doesn't need color. The original cartridge lasts for a long time if you use the economical printing mode.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: easy to setup and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have had my HP Laserjet 1020 for about a month now. This printer was easy to setup out of the box. I had no problems installing the printer or the software on my Win2000 machine. Instructions running from the CD in the drive were clear and easy to follow. This printer is attached to an older computer from which I don't print things every day; but so far I have had no issues with the printer. The only thing that might bother some is that the printer does NOT come with a paper manual only an electronic version on the CD.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hebner

customer_reviews.title: great lil printer,  BUT
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my original HP 4L Laser jet after 15 years. This seems to do a great job so far, much faster downloads and clean print,BUT BEWARE.... IT DOES NOT COME WITH A USB CORD TO CONNECT, so if the printer your replacing has the old stle connecter (as mine did) be ready to spend another $35.00 for a usb cord. That is why I gave it 4 instead of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Briggs

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: cannot use the printer. Missing a cable between the computer and the machine
customer_reviews.author: Florian Duchesne

customer_reviews.title: Good printers.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good workhorse printers. We've been using them in an office environment for years. Toner is a bit spendy unfortunately. Out of around 5+ that we have i've only had to send one in for repairs, and user 'error' probably caused that.
customer_reviews.author: BGL

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had one for 8 years before it conked out on me. after a year this one is going strong.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Pollard

customer_reviews.title: GREAT printer!
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor--if you need to hanlde envelopes, just spend the extra buck or two and get an HP. Canon inkjets are the best out. But there are no more long lasting and reliable laser printers than HP. I've tried Samsung, Brother, you name it. They act nutty, break down, do not handle diffrent media types well, and are bad at envelope printing. HP is where its at. Shame on HP for not providing Mac drivers for most of their printers--esp the lower cost ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought this used HP 1020 - very pleased. I have four of these workhorse printers for ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this used HP 1020 - very pleased. I have four of these workhorse printers for my business.
customer_reviews.author: Pat The Cat

customer_reviews.title: Printer Love
customer_reviews.text: I adore this printer. I got it to replace the HP LaserJet 4P, which replaced my HP LaserJet II. It is fast. I rarely jams. When it jams, it tells you what to do to unjam it. It is small. It is quiet. I'm a writer and print a lot of pages, and this puppy does the job far better than its predecessors.
customer_reviews.author: E. Burian-Mohr

customer_reviews.title: Great printer with small issues
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this printer is great for light-duty office use (I bought it for a small office workgroup). We have a mix of Linux and Windows PCs. The printer is shared through a Server2003 box and all works well. You have to go and find linux drivers for this printer (try http:\\foo2zjs.rkkda.com for a GREAT linux walkthrough) but after installing the new drivers, it works great. One small issue that I have is that I can't get a Windows 2000 PC to duplex print. The driver doesn't pop up the "continue" message to get it to print on the other side of the page...
customer_reviews.author: xder345

customer_reviews.title: A great office work horse
customer_reviews.text: I work out of my home and just needed a good old-fashioned, fast, B/W printer. This printer spits out pages at a very fast pace, it prints clearly, the toner lasts a long time and (knock on wood) it has not jammed in the year I have owned it! The only draw back is I can't figure out how to make it print labels on envelopes. (Which could be user error).
customer_reviews.author: Sara-Toga

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I wish someone could actually refurbish to original mode. This machine pulls hard to grab paper from tray. Other machine had fuser go out, so this is replacement. Wish it were quieter, but it prints. Perhaps seller could help?
customer_reviews.author: linda roar

customer_reviews.title: After two tries, it's O.K.
customer_reviews.text: The first printer did not work at all -- the paper crunched up like an accordion. After several phone calls and emails, including having to take and send pictures of the problem, a second printer was sent out (at no expense to me) and that one works O.K. Note: neither printer arrived with a partially-filled toner cartridge, as was advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Alan R.

customer_reviews.title: great low cost quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a small bodied laser printer which "flies" and is a cost saver for the everyday text printing that needs no fancy color etc. Very happy, easy to use, easy to install, cartridges life makes for inexpensive running. Perfect for the student, home office and personal use. A good looking unit.
customer_reviews.author: Roe

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Printer
customer_reviews.text: This little printer prints fast and clearly. I always thought a laser printer would be out of reach for me, cost-wise, but Amazon's price was quite reasonable (in fact it's still the lowest I've seen, a month later). Most of the things I print are in b&w anyway and I love not having to wait while my inkjet printer grinds out a page. I recommend this printer wholeheartedly.
customer_reviews.author: Toolgirl12x

customer_reviews.title: HP LASER JET 1020
customer_reviews.text: This is by far, the absolutely best printer (for black and white images) I've ever purchased / used. The toner cartridges last for 2 to 3 thousand pages and the images are perfect every time - and they've printed out in the time others machines would be warming up (like my Ink Jet unit). Thanks HP ... WONDERFUL PIECE OF EQUIPMENT at a reasonable, affordable price. You've renewed my faith in HP ... KEEP IT UP.
customer_reviews.author: R.F. Bacharach

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace my HP Laserjet III, which was approximately 18 years old and only needed service once. The printer was delivered a few days earlier than I expected it. Even though the USB cable didn't come with it, I looked around at home and found that I had a spare one. I preloaded the software supplied with the printer and it was fully functional in under 15 minutes. I'm more than pleased with my selection. I hope this one lasts as long as the HP III did.
customer_reviews.author: Shesha Girl

customer_reviews.title: Good for the task bought for
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to replace a DeskJet in a dedicated application. The DeskJet was just too slow. I needed a small, low-power printer. This one fit the bill. Startup time is very quick. Printing speed is good and print quality (text only) is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Glen E. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Entry Level Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: If you need a home light duty printer that provides professional laser printed documents perhaps say for a small home business or a private laser printer for an executive's office this is perfect. It is not for huge jobs or big projects but for the little jobs that need professional flair.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little printer. I paid a lot less for it years ago. It's held up fine. I get the remanufactured toner here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Solzhenitsyn

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Just needed a simple printer to work with my remote computer. The printers at my office are not the most current, but this matched what they had so it works well for me. Price was great.
customer_reviews.author: K. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Better than the 1012. Great for Macs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Laserjet 1020 needing a second printer. I have a 1012 already, and my only complaint is that it produces warped printouts. But I like that it's fast, quiet, and Mac-friendly. The 1020 is all of the above, and it doesn't bend the pages. Just download the 1022 Mac driver from hp to get it running. I'm thinking of replacing the 1012 now with another 1020. Two thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Lover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is simple to set up and prints quickly. It has the all in one toner cartridge which I have found refurbished for under $40, not that I've needed a refill after 3 months. It works with Vista which is a consideration if you have a new computer as Vista has issues with a lot of components. Overall a solid printer.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Evidentally not networkable
customer_reviews.text: A quick little printer and a great value for the money. I did not do my homework and evidentally it is not networkable. If you want to make it a network printer with a print server, you must purchase the slightly more expensive 1022 model.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Reader

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd HP printer. Each one has been better than the last. They are all still working and the toner cartridges last forever (at least they just seem to). I would never consider buying any other brand of printer again, ever!
customer_reviews.author: Alan S

customer_reviews.title: HP Laser Jet 1020
customer_reviews.text: These laserjets are well designed, work well and are easy to use. (We use 5 of the similar 1012 model and they are good workhorses. The 1020's installation disk is great -- with good pictures, easy instructions that any normal person could follow. Much better than the manuals written in engineering language. HP should be complimented.
customer_reviews.author: L. Krauss

customer_reviews.title: My new HP printer
customer_reviews.text: I really have enjoyed this new printer and I'm looking forward to using it for months before I have to replace the cartridge! If you don't need a color printer and you want something that just goes and goes this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy D. Ericksen

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, bad for Mac computers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great computer, but unfortunately it only uses Windows----which I have a Mac. It is a good printer, but make sure you have Windows before purchasing or it's a big hassle. BTW--it's B&W only & works very well!!
customer_reviews.author: LL

customer_reviews.title: HP Laserjet 1020 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer works well. My issues with it are: rebuilt with different color parts (not the first time I bought rebuilt but never had this issue) and no plastic dust cover for paper (also used as a loading area for labels, envelopes, etc.)
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Brown

customer_reviews.title: good printer
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this printer for my personal use at home. It is good and reliable printer for the price. Somehow, it arrived with software instalation CD in a forein language which was a big inconvenience. The white color chose by manufacturer is a questionable. It is a white spot in a room and I bet for many households it can be a problem. Also, lack of any controls buttons is inconvenient to restart a job even after paper reload.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: Not Mac Compatible, broke before printing a few thousand pages
customer_reviews.text: This printer, though mostly functional when connected to a Windows box, did not work without significant amounts of effort when connected to a Mac. Customer support at HP was not helpful in resolving my Mac connectivity issues. I eventually got it working with some 3rd party tools, but then the printer power supply died. I called HP customer support again and was told to buy a new HP printer. Needless to say, this is the last HP printer I will own. I suggest looking at some of the Brother models instead.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Lee

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, dependable worklhorse
customer_reviews.text: I'd like to give this 5 stars -- but, nothing is perfect! However, this comes as close to a first class dependable printer as you can get.
customer_reviews.author: Morton Zarcoff

customer_reviews.title: Nice little printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is one great printer. I've been using this for 6 months without a glitch. This is the 3rd printer I've owned. Had 2 Dells that were horrible. This printer is quick, quiet, and fits nicely on a desk.
customer_reviews.author: BubbaBoy

customer_reviews.title: genealogy buff
customer_reviews.text: With the volumes of paper needed to ditribute a genealogy report an ink jet just would not be efficient. I selected this printer for ease of use and reported durability by other known users. It was easy to set up in our LAN system and has quickly become the printer of choice on the network of 5 printers. It is fast and produces excellent quality work. At this time we have not used it long enough for durability issues however it has been trouble free and did a great job on label printing for a mailing also.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Markham

customer_reviews.title: Obviously, I owned one previously and loved it, so I love this one ,too.
customer_reviews.text: Simple laser copier, and it was just what I wanted. I did not want anything with a lot of extras, so I got something light weight, small, and simple.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Good work horse
customer_reviews.text: Very dependable. Came back to this after another lousy printer croaked. I had one of these years ago and had given to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: DaveInBoston

customer_reviews.title: best printer
customer_reviews.text: this is the best printer i've purchased. i just really like the reliability and quality of this old hp product.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: hp 1020
customer_reviews.text: have owned this model printer for 6-7 years. a real little workhorse. toner is cheap and you do get your monies worth.
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY J PRISCO JR

customer_reviews.text: The 1020 is fast, quiet, dependable and doesn't gobble gallons of ink like the new ink jets. I have given up using my photo quality ink jet printer in favor of this one unless we specifically need something in color.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: HP 1020 Laser
customer_reviews.text: Been using this printer for about 6 months and love it. Got tired of replacing the color ink cartriges in inkjet printers to make them print monochrome. This printer is a lot faster than inkjets anyway, both warmup and print speed. Ink cost works out just over 3 cents a copy using HP toner cartriges. Had no trouble setting up on XP desktop.
customer_reviews.author: gg

customer_reviews.title: Second HP LaserJet
customer_reviews.text: My 12-year old HP LaserJet 4L finally died after years of good service. Based on that experience, I replaced it with the HP LaserJet 1020. The setup was easy and the prints are crisp and clear. As expected, it is much faster than the 4L, to the point is prints as soon as I his the print button.
customer_reviews.author: N. Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the same printer I have been using for 5 1/2 years. It has performed well and I'm looking forward to this new one to do the same. Great printer!
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: If you don't need color, this is the laser printer for your home needs. I don't know how it would hold up in a business with heavy use but for home use it is fine for me. I could not ask for better, clearer prints. It's great for forms, letters, etc. Great little laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: R. Mims

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I knew a 1020 would work well in windows, and now I know that it works well as well in FreeBSD 9.1 and Ubuntu 12.04. Its a good printer. I like the way my old hp1200 laserjet works with big piles of envelopes, but otherwise, the 1020 is super.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: fast, inexpensive and reliable printer
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommended. Most people can live without a color printer for everyday printing. This laser printer is much faster and provides better quality printing than inkjet printers. I has spending way to much money buying replacement ink cartridges for my old printer. Very happy I switched to a laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: P. R.

customer_reviews.title: A decent, hardworking little printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer back in July when our old, problematic Cannon died. So far, it's done well, with no problems. It prints well, does everything it needs to do. No frills, but who cares? It's a solid, basic - well priced - bit of hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: Quick and fast transaction. Printer is great. Got at a great price. Highly recommend this laser printer.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: 5* Printer
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding value, easy to set up and delivery was excellent. Very satisfied with the printer and the quality.
customer_reviews.author: E. Lara-Navarro

customer_reviews.title: It was good; ) it did meet my expectation for a ...
customer_reviews.text: It was good ;) it did meet my expectation for a cheap price printer
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A bit noisy..
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a bit noisy, but otherwise works well. A good price/value relationship.
customer_reviews.author: Rosebud

customer_reviews.title: Good medium duty printer!
customer_reviews.text: As a teacher this is a good selection for a classroom printer; it is compact and durable. It is a tad noisy, though.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Lecakes-jones

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: It is a great printer. I first bought one for my office, then bought one for home.
customer_reviews.author: Md Shaheed

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer to buy. I got it for $99 with free shipping so that is just very cheap. Have been using for a couple of months now and no problems at all. Very good printer and easy to use and set up. You should buy this printer!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Vuong

customer_reviews.title: HP Laserjet 1020 Printer Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I have several similar HP Laserjet printers at work and purchased them at Office Depot or Office Max for $150-170 so this was a great buy at $99 with free shipping. I received it within 48 hours which was totlally unexpected since I was told that with the free shipping, it would not go out for about a week.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: HP LaserJet 1020 Printer
customer_reviews.text: It woorks very well. But when I cancel it because of error, it took forever to cancel. So I can't wait anymore an I turn off and turn on gain. Sometimes I use next printer in other to finish it quickly. This is not convenient compare to other printer.
customer_reviews.author: Young O. Kwon Kim

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer, great value
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for home or small home office use. Easy to set up, fast, very affordable. Only complaints are minor. It should include a usb cable (although that would raise the price a hair) and though I am a dinosaur I know, some sort of owners' manual would be nice. The CD was easy to use and I have had many printers in my life but I like to refer to something written now and again. All in all, I am very happy with this purchase. I r
customer_reviews.author: A. Greco

customer_reviews.title: terrific little laser printer and at a cheap price!
customer_reviews.text: I had been tipped off by a professional friend of mine that he has 5 of these HP 1020s in use in his accounting business. He claims other printers have failed him but this model has withstood heavy use. That was sufficient recommendation for me - but you know what? He is correct! I'm quite happy with mine and rate it high for quality and value!
customer_reviews.author: RRP

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have excellent experiance with HP printers. I like all HP products. This printer was correct choice I made it for my problem and It solve it, Coz I was looking for printer for Windows 98 and this 1 which I got it ;)
customer_reviews.author: S. Boutros

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: This refurbushed printer was like new. Received within a few days, installed and printed with out any issues. Great printer that will last us for years with proper maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: KO

customer_reviews.title: Little Engine that Could
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer strictly for traveling. I need to print hundreds of pages when I go to Las Vegas. I shipped the printer there, opened it, printed about 600 pages, and shipped it back home. It's just like the 1010 I have at home, it works great. Easy decision...
customer_reviews.author: Msmutty

customer_reviews.title: Badass
customer_reviews.text: Printer is of solid construction, works great, and is plenty fast for my personal business/home needs.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer 294

customer_reviews.title: Great daily use printer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer going for the last 3 weeks, and printing 5 to 15 pages a day. Yes it works, and works well! I would order this printer again.
customer_reviews.author: CHailbronner

customer_reviews.title: HP LaserJet 1020 & Windows Vista
customer_reviews.text: A number of reviewer have reported what HP's support site reports - that the LaserJet 1020 does not work on Windows Vista. Just use the original driver CD that comes with the printer and run the installation on Vista. The installer automatically detects the printer and installs the driver. This printer works perfectly with these drivers on Windows Vista Home Premium edition.
customer_reviews.author: K. Gupta

customer_reviews.title: she was so happy, worked perfect even though it was
customer_reviews.text: bought this for my mom to replace her broken 1020, she was so happy, worked perfect even though it was used
customer_reviews.author: C. Wese

customer_reviews.title: Office Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a small foot print and highly functional printer. It was a bit confusing to set up but I have not had any problems with it; I have used it everyday since the end of June.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Pomykalski

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in, Plug it in!!
customer_reviews.text: Much faster than my old 2100. Hard to beat for the price. Plugged in USB cable and printing in 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: N. A. Mcsweyn

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: its not a bad printer but after printing about 3 mins later it would make a sound as if it were going to print again it comes out of the blue and sometimes startles me other than that its a good printer speed wise-i cant really say much because i dont printer alot at a time
customer_reviews.author: Jacky

customer_reviews.title: The printer is not usable!
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked for a little while but then it produced black streaks on the paper so it is not usable so how can I get my money back?
customer_reviews.author: Jon Mohr

customer_reviews.title: ... were supplied by Advanced Printers and they came in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.text: The printers were supplied by Advanced Printers and they came in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: dlazzaro

customer_reviews.title: Worked out great. It was exactly how it was described in ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked out great.It was exactly how it was described in the ad.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Works fine on Windows 7
customer_reviews.text: Infuriating printer. Cheap, works well most of the time. But if you EVER run out of paper on Windows 10, forget about it. You may as well throw the printer out. Reboot the computer, turn the printer on and off, remove the driver, reinstall the driver, none of it works. Works fine on Windows 7, but not 10. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: brunt

customer_reviews.title: 1020 printer stopped working after few months
customer_reviews.text: I can't beleive this printer only worked for 3 months. I bought it last Dec, but only start to use it 3 months ago. Now it stopped working. Does anybody know this printer has any warranty? Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: It's not true. I get gypped..
customer_reviews.text: It's not true. when I received the printer, I found that the printer did not have any cartridge. so, I had to buy the cartridge. the information is not true. be careful. I was very upset.
customer_reviews.author: In-tek Oh

product_meta.title: HP Laserjet 1020 Printer (Q5911A#ABA)
product_meta.description:
HP LASERJET 1020 PRINTER

AMAZON.COM
The HP 1020 LaserJet smoothly process documents containing text, images, and graphics with its speedy 234MHz processor and ample 2 MB of memory. Jobs will print out at a quick 15 pages per minute, and thanks to HP's Instant-on technology, the first page emerges in less than 10 seconds from a cold start. The included FastRes 1,200 dpi effective print quality and HP's Resolution Enhancement technology (REt) ensures professional looking print jobs every time.

 Ideal for home use or at an office where space is of concern, the printer's compact design conserves desk space and can even be stored on a shelf if needed. The printer features a 150-sheet input tray, a single-sheet tray, a priority input slot for specialty paper, and a 125-sheet output bin (all of which hold medias measuring up to 9 x 11 inches). Connecting the printer to a PC is a cinch. Initial set up is fast and easy with the printer's high-speed USB 2.0 connection. The printer is backed by a 1-year limited manufacturer's warranty and is compatible with Windows 98SE operating systems and later. Measuring 4.6 x 9.5 x 8.2 inches, the printer weighs only 11 pounds.

 What's in the Box
1020 printer, HP LaserJet Q2612A black print cartridge, getting started guide, CD (includes software and user's guide), and power cord.
feature_bullets: Affordable and reliable LaserJet desk printer
Crisp and clear 1,200 dpi print quality
Prints up to 15 pages per minute
Use only Original HP Toner in your HP printer for great results, print after print
